meanings.definition: To cause annoyance or trouble to
meanings.sent2: Please don't bother the cat while she's sleeping.
meanings.sent3: The buzzing mosquito bothered the picnic guests.
meanings.sent4: The constant dripping of the leaky faucet bothered her like a persistent itch.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on his shirt bothered him all day long.

meanings.definition: To take the trouble to do something
meanings.sent1: I'll bother to clean my room later.
meanings.sent2: She didn't bother to read the instructions before assembling the furniture.
meanings.sent3: He decided to bother baking cookies for the school fundraiser.
meanings.sent4: She bothered to learn sign language to communicate with her deaf neighbor.
meanings.sent5: The chef bothered to create a special menu for the VIP guests.
